title: Princess Diana's 'final heartbreak' and her special relationship with Pakistan
text:
It seems somewhat incongruous that Diana, Princess of Wales’s special connection with Pakistan should have been born at Wimbledon’s Centre Court. Seated near the country’s then prime minister, Benazir Bhutto in the royal box in 1989, the two women struck up conversation and before long, an invitation was extended for the Princess to visit the war-torn country. A military coup the following year – in which Bhutto was overthrown – put paid to her original plan, but two years later, in 1991, Diana touched down in Islamabad for her first solo royal tour.

It came at a time when rumours about the state of the Wales’s marriage were mounting, and the whole trip was widely expected to be a failure. “There...
description: It seems somewhat incongruous that Diana, Princess of Wales’s special connection with Pakistan should have been born at Wimbledon’s Centre Court.
